name: Shuttle
subtitle: Stock
desc: The shortest path between you and intergalactic travel.

name: Anvil
subtitle: 2310 Version
desc: This reliable old workhorse was conquering planets while you learned to walk

name: Vespid
subtitle: 2345 Upgrade
desc: Rugged first-string fighter of the Compact.

name: Corsair
subtitle: Hotrodded
desc: A ruthless ship for ruthless people

name: Lovelace
subtitle: General Services
desc: The Lovelace is unique mostly for its degree of automation. The AI runs the ship, so it can be operated with a skeleton crew if needed.

name: Harrier
subtitle: 2311 Upgrade
desc: Old technolgy in a still-competitive package. The Compact has all but phased this fighter out, but you can still find examples on the civilian market and in the hands of independent planets.

name: Superhauler
subtitle: Cargo Megaship
desc: Superhaulers are the biggest cargo ship you can get. Though it’s the largest ship in production, it’s size is deceptive – in order to reach the cargo sections, you need to spacewalk across the frame.

name: Flathead
subtitle: Gunship
desc: The versitile flathead might not be suited to dogfighting, but it’s much better at almost everything else.

name: Sledge
subtitle: Slam Drive
desc: A big monolithic engine, big monolithic hull, big monolithic everything. This slab of a ship has stuck around for a long time and shows no sign of stopping. Crews may swear at its unreliable electronics or tight corridors, but they swear by its battering-ram hull and simplicity of maintenance.

name: Screamer
subtitle: Beam Boat
desc: If Green has a special sauce, this is it. Most ships start with a spaceframe, engine, or cargo configuration and work from there. The Screamer was built around its massive beam. It’s got one job, as they say.

name: Strix
subtitle: Escort
desc: The long, sleek Strix is ostensibly a civilian ship, but its armament might suggest otherwise. A symbol of an increasingly dangerous galaxy. Built to stand up against pirates and Compact patrols.

name: Raptor
subtitle: Supercorvette
desc: The Compact’s ace in the hole. Faster than it’s got any right to be at its size and overarmed, the Raptor is a ship to be feared (and best engaded from far away.)

name: Franklin
subtitle: Strike Fighter
desc: The Franklin is named for the mythical hero who stole electricity from the gods.

name: Khwarizmi
subtitle: Bomber
desc: A big sloped sheet of frontal armor sets the tone for this bruiser.
